abstract: An observable representation of a webpage’s previously loaded resources.
overview:
## Overview

This type can be used to facilitate navigating to prior or subsequent loaded resources and for observing when new entries get added or removed.

In this example, the back-forward list is used to create a SwiftUI View to facilitate navigating to previous or next items:

The view can then be used for both the back and forward list using a specific [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WebPage]:

Because [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WebPage/backForwardList-swift.property] is an observable property, the states of these buttons are automatically updated.

items.description: A representation of a resource that a webpage previously visited.
items.name: WebPage.BackForwardList.Item

items.description: The array of items that precede the current item.
items.name: backList

items.description: The array of items that follow the current item.
items.name: forwardList

items.description: Accesses the item at the relative offset from the current item.
items.name: subscript(_:)

items.description: A particular state that occurs during the progression of a navigation.
items.name: WebPage.NavigationEvent

title: WebPage.BackForwardList
